turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Let's string him up by his pull- string!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: I got dibs on his hat!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Oh, quit your whining and pay up.

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: No, no, not the ear.  Gimme the nose.  C'mon!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Son of a building block, it's Woody!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Did I get my package in the mail?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I'll have to perform one of my...operations!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Sid, give her back!  Give her back now!  I'm telling!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: She's lying!  Whatever she says it's not true!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Oh, ya big lizard!  Now we'll never know what it is!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Where's my ear?  Who's seen my ear? Did you see my ear?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Outta my way!  Here I come, here I come --

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Well, that MISTAKE is sitting in your spot, Woody.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: And I'm from Mattel.  Well, I'm not actually  from Mattel, I'm actually from a smaller company that was purchased in a leveraged buy-out. Well, I don't really understand the financials, but...

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Gettin' kind of tense, aren't you?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Oh, uh, Mr. Lightyear?  Now I'm curious.  What does a Space Ranger actually do?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: He tortures toys -- just for fun.

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Huh?!  Huh?!  I told you he was guilty.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Who would've thought he was capable of such atrocities?!

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: I'm sorry.  It's just that I get so nervous before I travel.

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: How did I get stuck with YOU as a moving buddy?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Well, obviously she wanted to have the party before the move.  I'm not worried.  You shouldn't be worried.

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Of course Woody ain't worried! He's been Andy's favorite since kindergarten!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: All right, that's enough.  Look, we're all very impressed with Andy's new toy --

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Yeah.  Like the attic.  Heh, heh...

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: I can't tell.  Hey, where's Lenny?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Wait a minute.  You -- you don't think I meant to knock Buzz out the window, do you Potato Head?

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: That's Mr. Potato Head to you, you back-stabbin' murderer!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Now, it was an accident!  Guys, c'mon now, you...you gotta believe me

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Good going, Slink!  Now, just, just tie it on to something!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Wait!  Wait!  I got a better idea! How about we DON'T?!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Did you all take stupid pills this morning?!  Have you forgotten what he did to Buzz?  And now you want to let him back over here?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, no, no!  You got it all wrong, Potato Head.  Buzz is fine!  Buzz is right here.  He's with me!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, I'm not!  Buzz, come over here and you just tell the nice toys that you're not dead.

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Wait just a minute.  What are you trying to pull?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, it's not what you think, I swear!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Save it for the jury.  I hope Sid pulls your voice-box out, ya creep!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No!  No!  Don't leave!  Don't leave! You've gotta help us, please!  You don't know what it's like over here!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Come on.  Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No wait!  You don't understand! Buzz is out there!  We've gotta help him!!

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Were you scared?  Tell me honestly.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: I was close to being scared that time.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: C'mon, guys!  Every Christmas and birthday we go through this.

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: But what if Andy gets another dinosaur?  A mean one?  I just don't think I can take that kind of rejection.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hey, listen, no one's getting replaced.  This is Andy we're talking about.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: If I send out the troops, will you all calm down?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Shouldn't they be there by now? What's taking them so long?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hey, these guys are professionals. They're the best.  C'mon, they're not lying down on the job.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Ha ha.  That's very funny, Buzz.  This is serious!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hi ya, fellas.  To infinity and beyond!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Yeah, hey Buzz.  Let's show the guys our new secret best-friends hand shake.  Gimme five, man!

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: Wait!  There's a nice little one over there!

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: What the heck is up there?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: Woody?  Who's up there with you?

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: I thought he was at summer camp!

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: We believe you, Woody.  Right, Rex?

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: It's too short!  We need more monkeys!

turns.speaker: REX
turns.text: There aren't any more!  That's the whole barrel.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Uh, hey Sarge, have you seen Slinky?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Sargent.  Establish a recon post downstairs.  Code red.  You know what to do.

turns.speaker: SARGENT
turns.text: Come in, Mother Bird, this is Alpha Bravo.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: This is it!  This is it!  Quiet, quiet, quiet!

turns.speaker: SARGENT
turns.text: Come in, Mother Bird. Alright...Andy's opening the first present now.

turns.speaker: SARGENT
turns.text: Okay, we're on the last present now...

turns.speaker: SARGENT
turns.text: It's a big one...It's a...it's a boardgame!  Repeat!  Battleship -- Battleship, the boardgame!

turns.speaker: SARGENT
turns.text: Mission accomplished.  Well done, men.  Pack it up, we're going home.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: So did I tell ya?  Huh?  Nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: SARGENT
turns.text: Juvenile intrusion!  Repeat! Resume your positions NOW!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Andy's coming, everybody!  Back to your places.  Hurry!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Buzz.  Buzz Lightyear.  You are not worried, are you?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Just stay where you are, Corporal! Don't move, Carl.  You'll blow up. I know you're tired!  I know your leg is cramping, but you can't move. Do you hear me?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: This town ain't big enough for the two of us!

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: Oh...well alright, you can be red if you want.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Not now, Slink.  I've got some bad news.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Just gather everyone up for a staff meeting and be happy!!

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: Woody, what are you doing under the bed?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Uh-h-h-h...nothing!  Uh, nothing. I'm sure Andy was just a little excited, that's all.  Too much cake and ice cream, I suppose.  It's just a mistake.

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: Heh, heh, heh!  Golly bob howdy --

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, shut up!  In a couple of days, everything will be just the way it was.  They'll see... they'll see. I'm still Andy's favorite toy.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: We're gonna get outta here, Buzz -- Buzz?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Boy, am I glad to see you guys!

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: I knew you'd come back, Woody!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Ha, ha, oh, I love you, too.

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: See?  It is Buzz.  Now give back the lights, Potato Head.

turns.speaker: SLINKY
turns.text: I can't hold on much longer!

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: You'll need to know who we are, we're the brothers of his wife, which makes us in an unsanctified kind of way, your uncles. Me name is Finn, me brother is called Francie -

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: There's no law, as I know of, to prevent it.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Do you know you've lovely hair, even if you torment it in those braids.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: You're spoiling your pretty looks. Come here.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Curled up on the landing like love locked out!

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: I carried you up to your bed.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: He can't abide a woman in trousers. He says a woman in trousers is a sin against nature.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Slip up and change into a skirt, else he'll create something terrible. Don't you want to make a good impression on your first day?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Is there anything else I should know about him?

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Speak when you're spoken to. He likes his women quiet.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I saw his teeth in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: He can take out his smile and keep it on a shelf, but, his bite is worse than his bark, isn't that so, old fellow?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Mummy was scared of him, I think. He went to her wedding but he was furious, you can see it in the photograph.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: He made that. In his off hours.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: It's as though he'd trapped a real cuckoo inside.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Didn't you know he made things?

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Don't fret. It's only his dream. Dreams aren't catching, not like measles.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I didn't know about the puppets. It's a lot to take in, all at once.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Home is where the heart is.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I can't go home because there's no home left.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: She's not accustomed to being ignored.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: That's your beach. This is the story. Leda walks by the shore, gathering shells.  Night comes on. She hears the beating of great wings and sees the approach of the swan. She runs away but it bears down and casts her to the ground. Curtain.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Ah, you should see the swan! His masterpiece. Now, walk along the beach and stoop to pick up the shell.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Finn, there's a splinter in your left foot.  If you don't let me take the splinter out, it will fester.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: I won't do it because he wants me to do it, even if I want to do it.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Living with him put years on me.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Can I come into bed with you for a little while, I feel terrible.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Would you mind holding me in your arms for a little while?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You are cold. Where have you been?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He'll murder you when he finds out.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: He'll be looking for another apprentice.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I hope he doesn't pick on Jonathon.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Can you move over a wee bit?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: The swan was so ridiculous. All the same, it did scare me.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: Almighty Jove in the shape of a swan.

turns.speaker: FINN
turns.text: I've got a present for you...

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I know for a fact he didn't take Jonathon. Jonathon went off by himself.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Nothing ... You shouldn't have given Victoria that Guinness.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Do you think we should take her up to bed?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I thought she was fondest of you, because you were the youngest.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: But then I had a brother and a sister left.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: They're going to fly everywhere. Mean things. They should have taken us.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: I'm not too young. Juliet was my age.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: In the play. She was married, by my age. And Mummy. Mummy wasn't much older than me when she got married. Well, not that much older.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: What? Did you let that child play with one of my toys? I don't like children playing with my toys.  Have to fix you up with another hammer, won't we. Give her a saucepan to play with, that'll do.
